triples.name: Fuzzy logic
triples.relevance: Fuzzy logic systems are used to approximate unknown nonlinear dynamics in the multi-agent control system.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a bipartite formation tracking control strategy for nonlinear multi-agent systems with cooperative and competitive relationships.

triples.name: Nonlinear control
triples.relevance: The paper develops control strategies for nonlinear multi-agent systems using fuzzy logic and nonlinear state transformations.

triples.name: Adaptive control
triples.relevance: An adaptive fuzzy bipartite formation tracking control strategy is proposed that adjusts to system parameters and uncertainties.

triples.name: Control theory
triples.relevance: The paper applies control theory principles to develop formation tracking and self-triggered control mechanisms for multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Distributed control system
triples.relevance: A distributed dynamic self-triggered control mechanism is proposed to improve communication efficiency in directed communication topologies.

triples.name: Feedback control
triples.relevance: Feedback control principles are used in the bipartite formation tracking strategy where agents adjust based on tracking errors.

triples.name: Fuzzy control system
triples.relevance: The paper proposes an adaptive fuzzy control system that approximates unknown nonlinear dynamics to handle constrained outputs.
